qas.question: What did the party adopt before the 1980s?
What party was described as democratic socialist?
When have social democratic parties in America been transformed?
What has strengthened the party's relationship with trade unions?
What did the Conservative party do from the 1980s onward?

context: From the late-1980s onwards, the party <b4_0>adopted <b0_0>free market policies<b4_0/><b0_0/>, leading many observers to describe the <b1_0>Labour<b1_0/> Party as social democratic or the Third Way, rather than democratic socialist. Other commentators go further and argue that traditional social democratic parties across Europe, including the British Labour Party, have been so deeply transformed in <b2_0>recent years<b2_0/> that it is no longer possible to describe them ideologically as 'social democratic', and claim that this <b3_0>ideological shift<b3_0/> has put new strains on the party's traditional relationship with the trade unions.
